posts._title: Paul Morrissey & Antonio Margheriti – Flesh for Frankenstein (1973)
posts.title: Flesh for Frankenstein
posts.excerpt: In Serbia, Baron Frankenstein lives with the Baroness and their two children. He dreams of a super-race, returning Serbia to its grand connections to ancient Greece. In his laboratory, assisted by Otto, he builds a desirable female body, but needs a male who will be superbody and superlover. He thinks he has found just the …

posts.title: Pussikaljaelokuva
posts.excerpt: Pussikaljaelokuva shows us a, particularly trying, day in the life of three marginalized young men: Marsalkka (Jussi Nikkilä), Henninen (Eero Milonoff) and Lihis (Ylermi Rajamaa). They are just out to enjoy a nice summer’s day with the intention of playing yahtzee, but things don’t quite go their way. They have their run-ins with a recently …

posts.title: Roberte
posts.excerpt: Quote:Unlike the erotic surrealism mastery of his peer-filmmakers such as Buñuel, Robbe-Grillet and even Raúl Ruiz, Pierre Zucca in his Roberte (adapted from Pierre Klossowski’s novel) tends mostly toward a “non-professionalism” and aesthetical economy. Where the enchanting force of his work is driven by an atmospheric sense of strangeness and oddity, an ambient surreality: a …

posts.title: Vampire Junction
posts.excerpt: Quote:VAMPIRE JUNCTION, for example, takes an inexplicable mix of characters (cowboys, doctors, acrobatic nudist vampires, a Dracula-wannabee, drunks, etc.) and tosses them all into a tourist trap of an old West ghost town and allows them all to shake up against one another for 90 minutes or so. Who knows what happens or why? Seeing …

posts._title: Isold Uggadottir – Andið eðlilega AKA And Breathe Normally (2018)
posts.title: Andið eðlilega
posts.excerpt: Two women’s lives will intersect while trapped in circumstances unforeseen. Between a struggling Icelandic mother and an asylum seeker from Guinea-Bissau, a delicate bond will form as both strategize to get their lives back on track.

posts._title: Ali Ilhan – Sinyora Enrica ile Italyan Olmak AKA Signora Enrica (2010)
posts.title: Sinyora Enrica ile Italyan Olmak
posts.excerpt: The story of an exchange student from Turkey and his struggle to fit in Italy. (~IMDb)*Signora Enrica (Turkish: Sinyora Enrica ile İtalyan Olmak) is a 2010 Italo-Turkish comedy-drama film, written and directed by Ali İlhan, starring Claudia Cardinale as an elderly Italian woman who takes in a young Turkish exchange student.

posts._title: Antonio Maenza Blasco – Orfeo filmado en el campo de batalla (1969)
posts.title: Orfeo filmado en el campo de batalla
posts.excerpt: This is a digitally transferred work print of an exceptionally rare film. There is some light residual ghosting here and there. Quote:In December 1968 I participated in the film Orpheus Shot on the Battlefield, which originated as a collective work, a movie without an author, but which would ultimately be attributed to Antonio Maenza in …

posts._title: Michael Apted – The Up Series – 7 Plus Seven (1970)
posts.title: The Up Series – 7 Plus Seven
posts.excerpt: The premise behind the Up series is deceptively simple: take a cross-section of children at age 7, ask them about their hopes for the future, and then return every seven years to mark their progress. However, the results of these experiments, launched in 1963 by Britain’s Granada Television, are anything but mundane, and their revelations …

posts.title: Europa Report
posts.excerpt: An international crew of astronauts undertakes a privately funded mission to search for life on Jupiter’s fourth largest moon.

posts._title: Walter Hugo Khouri – As Filhas do Fogo (1978)
posts.title: As Filhas do Fogo
posts.excerpt: Quote:Woman living in São Paulo goes to Gramado, South of Brazil, to visit a friend of hers. Together, they meet an odd woman who engages in strange experiences in parapsychology. From then on, bizarre events are bound to happen.
